page.title: 16RELIGION ALL SAINTS CHURCH
page.content: {ALL SAINTS CHURCH FRESHWATER}was built in 1180 by Norman monks. The vicar is the Reverend Henley who also looks after another church in Freshwater called St.Agnes.Services at the church on Sundays are at 9.30 and 10.30 a.m. Bellringers practise on the seven big bells on Wednesdays from 7 to 9 p.m. The churchyard of All Saints has much of interest and is situated in an unusually rural area overlooking the river estuary now known as the River Yar. The largest grave is the "ANGEL" and near it is a large red marble statue in memory of Max Elliot.Also near the "Angel"is a headstone written in Dutch to the memory of Abraham Bournan. Around the chuch itself are a number of interesting stones which were probably re-positioned when the church was extended in 1875,some are cemented into the N and S walls.
